poem:
Title: In the Playhouse of Politics

In the quiet morning,
we, like fruits, ripen
under the heated headlines.
Impeachment - a bitter fruit,
served in the Senate's dish.

Republicans spar, Democrats plot,
a rouged dance on the politic stage,
while Mayorkas, like a moth,
flutters in the spotlight's rage.

Chuck Schumer, a farmer in the storm,
calls for dismissal, sowing a norm.
An end, before the start -
Such is the art, of political heart.
